chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intox Use of Vehicle (2nd+)
Homicide by Use of CMV with PAC (2nd+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Francis E Rychtik #332089 Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Francis E Rychtik #332089 Sr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Francis E Rychtik #332089 Sr was found guilty of Homicide by Intox Use of Vehicle (2nd+), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).
  • Francis E Rychtik #332089 Sr was found guilty of Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Financial obligation owed is to be paid from all funds received into defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the agent but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment.  Held open for 60 days.

The Def is to obtain and maintain full time employment.
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Do not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from a licensed physician with random testing.

No bars, taverns, liquor stores or restaurants where liquor is served

No operation of any vehicle requiring a CDL. Recommendation to DMV of lifetime revocation of CDL.

No contact with victims, their family or friends
.

Take all prescribed medications as directed

Provide DNA sample

Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Pay DOC supervision fees

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Def's Motion for Sentence Modification is DENIED - signed by TWB
From def Re: sent in Motion for Modification of sentence on 7/20 - checking to see if received.
Def's Motion for Sentence Modification filed by def Pro Se

State by Gruenke /  Def in custody from prison
Hrg by Zoom
Def:  I rec'd letter thru my Social Worker yesterday
State:  it is a matter of interpretation of the materials.  I think we are waiting for CRT to rule on the materials that Def submitted...Ms Skemp's letter lays it out well why we object
Def comments...being that I was sued w/ my employer & my insurance company I paid for the funeral.  I don't think I need to pay twice for it - in civil case too...
State:  I agree that the victims wouldn't be allowed double payment
CRT:  if it is for the same acts & same amounts awarded does it amount to double payment?
State:  I am going to rely on Ms Skemp's letter as our basis & argument
Def comments on what DOC is taking out - paid $1560.37 to F.S., $1792.74 to S.H., & $95.34 to CVC awarded money...
CRT:  have you paid anything under the Civil Judgment?
Def:  that was covered under my employers insurance company.  It was covering the whole law suiit...
CRT:  Criminal Courts can't order restitution for loss of companionship - things like that - that would be ordered in the Civil Suit - has the Civil case covered all lost wages?
Def:  yes, according to the signed Releases
CRT:  does it talk about 14CF669 Judgment?  Does it say the cae number & Judgment?
Def:  no it does not
CRT:  I don't believe that Release has any affect on this criminal case.  You may need to go back to the Civil Atty to have the monies specifically referenced.  The Judgment in this case was issued & there isn't anything I can do.  You will just have to see if you can get that.
Gruenke addresses def - send a letter directly to me & not the Court or Ms Skemp
CRT:  I AM NOT GOING TO CHANGE THE RESTITUTION ORDER AT THIS POINT.   See if you can get that clarified through your civil attys
Def comments on DOC taking 50% for restitution...
CRT:  I am aware of that.  The DOC has authority of taking up to 75 to 80% - there is nothing I can do to change that
Def:  the Court wouldn't do a set pymt on this every month?
CRT:  talk to Mr Gruenke on that
Def:  I shouldn't have to pay an unreasonable amount...
CRT:  I understand.  Mr Gruenke sounds like he will work w/ you if you get him the info that is workable.  If it is not clear it is hard for the DA to adopt & settle what is owed.  Restitution remains as is

WITNESS:  Lisa E. - PSI Writer
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Ct 1 - Def sentenced to WSP for total length of sentence of 25 yrs:
- Initial Term Confinement is 12 yrs w/ credit for 288 days;  DL revoked for 5 yrs / Ignition Interlock installed for 5 yrs;  Pay Blood Draw fee of $45;  During period of prison confinement, 25% of def's inmate funds are to be applied to restitution owed, per prison policy
- Extended Supervision is 13 yrs
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Ct 4 - Def sentenced to WSP for total length of sentence of 8 yrs:
- Initial Term of Confiment is 4 yrs - Consecutive to Ct 1;  DL revoked for 2 yrs / Ignition Interlock installed for 2 yrs
- Extended Supervision is 4 yrs
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  No Contct w/ victims, their family or friends;  AODA & follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  No alcohol, drugs or cont subs w/ o valid prescription, w/ random testing;  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or restaurants where alcohol is served;  Take all prescribed meds as directed;  Def to obtain & maintain full-time employment once released from prison;  No operation of any vehicle requiring a CDL - recommendation to DMV of lifetime revocation of CDL;  Provide DNA Sample;  Comply w/ any other assessments or evaluations deemed necessary by the PO & follow-through w/ any treatment recommendations;  Pay restitution - left open for 60 days to determine amount;  Pay CC & DOC fees
